Augusta-Richmond_County.B.C. Wall House: The B.C. Wall House, also known as the “Sesame Lodge,” is located at North Augusta, Aiken County, South Carolina. It was constructed in 1902 by Budd Clay Wall (the mayor of North Augusta at the time) to serve as an overflow guest home from the Hampton Terrace Hotel. The home holds additional significant in that it was designed by a female architect, Wall’s daughter, Martha Louise Wall Andrews.
